title: goinstall shouldn't update the package repo with invalid packages
body:
On 1 June 2010 09:16, Artem Titoulenko <artem.titoulenko@gmail.com> wrote:
> I do not know how the package list (http://godashboard.appspot.com/
> package) is generated but it is pretty erroneous in it's decision that
> mustache (http://github.com/defunkt/mustache) is a go package. It is a
> Ruby gem/plugin. This only raises the question as to whether more gems
> like this exist in the list. (heh)
>

goinstall should not update the package list if it doesn't find a valid Go package.
